moves.5. Nc3 d5: ?! Not a great pawn sac. Maybe Nxc3 should have been considered?
moves.6. Qe2: Next few moves develop as expected.
moves.6... Be7: Black will loose a little tempo here having to move the DSB twice in a matter of moves.
moves.7. Nxe4 dxe4 8. Qxe4 O-O 9. Bc4: Bd3 looks more obvious although is easily defended with 9...g6   a continuation would lead to black having good compensation for the pawn if he could get Bishops into play.
moves.9... Bd6 10. O-O: White is aiming for a quick development. The center is totally open. White has a good lead in development.
moves.10... Re8 11. Qd3 Nc6 12. b3: ! Nice move. Allows white to get DSB into play.
moves.12... Qf6 13. Bb2: Great move. Instead of holding on to pawns white is looking at bigger picture and attacks.
moves.13... Qxb2 14. Ng5 Be6: After 14.. g6 15. Bxf7+, Kg7. 16. Bxe8, Qe5. 17. Qc3,  Kd4. 18. f4  very nice  :)
moves.15. Bxe6 fxe6: Creates an isolated pawn but allows more room for King to escape.
moves.16. Qxh7+ Kf8 17. Rae1: IS c3 stronger? This move allows Queen to return home & defend.
moves.18... Kg8 19. Re3: Looking to get to h3 and force a back row mate.
moves.19... Bf4: Black trying to rid advanced knight.
moves.20. Qh7+ Kf8 21. Qh8+: White forced into playing winning exchange and wait for the win.
moves.21... Ke7 22. Rxe6+: Good move. Wins Queen & pawn in exchange for Rook and Knight
moves.22... Qxe6 23. Qxg7+ Kd6 24. Nxe6 Rxe6 2: Queenside pawn charge to pressure blacks king.
moves.25... Rae8: Black has to get rooks working togeather to make up for the lack of Queen.
moves.28... Rxd4: Black picks up the free pawn... but doesn't spot....
moves.29. c5#: Nice finish. Mate with a pawn   :)
